meanings.definition: Save too much money or resources beyond what is necessary.
meanings.sent1: She oversaved her allowance and had no money left to buy a toy.
meanings.sent2: He always oversaved for emergencies, keeping extra cash hidden at home.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel oversaved nuts for winter, filling every corner of its nest.
meanings.sent4: She oversaved her energy for the race, conserving every bit for the final sprint.
meanings.sent5: The student oversaved study time for the exam, spending hours reviewing each chapter.

meanings.definition: To have saved more than is needed or appropriate.
meanings.sent1: They oversaved food for the party, ending up with too many leftovers.
meanings.sent2: She oversaved clothes in her closet, never wearing half of them.
meanings.sent3: The ant oversaved crumbs in its anthill, creating a mountain of food.
meanings.sent4: He oversaved memories in his heart, cherishing every moment spent together.
meanings.sent5: The collector oversaved stamps, filling albums with duplicates of rare finds.
